messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 944- support
messages.msgSnippet: From: DACunefare@aol.com DACunefare@aol.com ... I had the exact opposite problem.  This brought back the memory.  I was huge people would guess I was
messages.messageBody:
From: "DACunefare@..." DACunefare@...
>>>By the time I was 6 1/2 months pregnant with my twins, it was common for
>>>people I met to comment "Any day now, hmmm?" I'd either make a
>>>noncommital noise if I wasn't in the mood for a discussion of twins, or
>>>else I'd say something like "no, not for another 2 months or so. Twins!"

I had the exact opposite problem. This brought back the memory. I was huge
people would guess I was pregnant in my first trimester. By the time I was
6 mo. pregnant I looked 8-9 months. People were always coming up to me
saying, "Oh must be twins." No, I was just huge! Speaking of rude people
DH and I stopped at a buffet diner in a small town btwn Dallas and Houston.
I (an already abnormally beg eater though I've never been bigger than a size
8) was loading my plate, when an elderly woman next to me says, "You know
you're not really eating for two." I thought DH was going to take her out.
So like others have said, no matter what the situation you're going to meet
rude disapproving people. Just gotta keep your chin up. I agree that if it
happens again it's important to let your ds know it was them not him.

Misty
